description: Number of partitions of n into its divisors with at least one part of size 1.
links: Alois P. Heinz, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
formula: Coefficient of x^(n-1) in expansion of 1/Product_{d divides n} (1-x^d). - _Vladeta Jovovic_, Apr 11 2004
maple: with(numtheory):a:= proc(n) option remember; local b, l; l:= sort([divisors(n)[]]):      b:= proc(m, i) option remember; `if`(m=0, 1, `if`(i<1, 0,             b(m, i-1)+`if`(l[i]>m, 0, b(m-l[i], i))))          end; forget(b):      b(n-1, nops(l))    end:seq(a(n), n=1..100); # _Alois P. Heinz_, Feb 05 2014
mathematica: a[n_] := a[n] = Module[{b, l}, l = Divisors[n]; b[m_, i_] := b[m, i] = If[m==0, 1, If[i<1, 0, b[m, i-1] + If[l[[i]]>m, 0, b[m-l[[i]], i]]]]; b[n-1, Length[l]]]; Table[a[n], {n, 1, 100}] (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Apr 07 2015, after _Alois P. Heinz_ *)
author: _Olivier Gérard_
